subject: College Athletics
Football
lead_paragraph: Tom Williams, an assistant with the Jacksonville Jaguars, has been hired at Yale, becoming the first black head football coach at the university. A person familiar with the decision confirmed the choice Monday on condition of anonymity because a formal announcement had not been made. The university called a news conference for 2 p.m. Wednesday to introduce the new coach. Williams replaces Jack Siedlecki, who retired in November after 12 seasons to become an assistant athletic director at Yale.
